model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Classmates A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Classmates A: I can't believe I got caught cheating on my taxes. This is such a mess.
Classmates B: Wait, what? You cheated on your taxes? That's not okay.
Classmates A: I know, I know. I was just really struggling financially and I thought I could get away with it.
Classmates B: You can't just cheat and hope to never get caught. That's not how it works.
Classmates A: Remember when we talked about me wanting to become a professional basketball player?
Classmates B: Yeah, I remember. So, what does that have to do with cheating on your taxes?
Classmates A: It's just that I feel like I keep hitting roadblocks in my life. Every time I try to move forward, something happens to set me back. It's really discouraging.
Classmates B: I understand that it can be tough, but cheating isn't the answer. You have to keep working hard and doing the right thing, even when it's hard.
Classmates A: On a completely different note, do you remember when I got a job at the local grocery store?
Classmates B: Yeah, you seemed really happy with that job.

[MEMORY]
Classmate B reassures Classmate A that they are all in it together and offers help if needed. - (SameTopic) - Classmates B advises Classmates A to stay focused on their goal, believe in themselves, and ask for help if needed. - (React) - Classmates A believes in hard work and dedication to achieve goals both in basketball and their job.
Classmate A has tried practicing in front of others but still feels nervous. - (React) - Classmates A has a big dream of becoming a professional basketball player and works hard towards that goal. - (React) - Both classmates have a positive attitude towards each other and their respective goals.
Classmate B advises Classmate A to take deep breaths, stay confident, and focus on delivery. - (SameTopic) - Classmates B advises Classmates A to stay focused on their goal, believe in themselves, and ask for help if needed. - (React) - Classmates A believes in hard work and dedication to achieve goals both in basketball and their job.

This work ethic can be inferred as the reason for his frustration at the setback due to the tax cheating issue. The MEMORY also provides information about Classmate Bâ€™s always supportive role towards Classmate A, with suggestions on focusing and believing in oneself.
